thread.title: EU mistakenly displays US flag with extra star during visit from Vice-president Mike Pence
thread.title_full: EU mistakenly displays US flag with extra star during visit from Vice-president Mike Pence

author: Associated Press
title: EU mistakenly displays US flag with extra star during visit from Vice-president Mike Pence
text:
T he Star-Spangled Banner looked more starry than usual during one of US Vice President Mike Pence's appearances in Brussels .
A background picture of the American flag that went up alongside the European Union flag as Mr Pence and EU leader Donald Tusk spoke on Monday had 51 stars instead of the usual 50, one for each state.
Credit: Barcroft Images T he Brussels version of the flag had three rows of nine stars and three rows with eight stars each. American flags typically feature a total of nine alternating rows of five or six stars.
The EU flag featuring 12 stars in a circle against a blue background was configured correctly. And the American flag had the right number of stripes - 13.
Watch | Mike Pence: US wants to deepen its relationship with the EU 01:21 T he EU Council did not immediately respond when asked about the error with the misplaced star-state. 
The flag has had 50 stars since Hawaii gained statehood in 1959. The EU may want to save the flag used on Monday just in case Washington, DC or Puerto Rico become number 51.
